intro: Adenoncos parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered adenoncos, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface.
